Data: Hello all, welcome to the second ODI at the Gabba. The news from the middle is that England have won the toss and will bat. They have also gone in with an unchanged side from the Melbourne ODI, despite the loss there. A win against the Prime Minister's XI might just have given them a little of the confidence that has been lacking.
McKay to Cook, 1 run Cook starts with a cut, gets it away to third man for a single
McKay to Bell, no run tempting line outside off from McKay and gets some away swing, Bell lets it through to Haddin
McKay to Bell, 1 wide McKay gets this one wrong, swinging it down leg side for a very wide wide
McKay to Bell, 2 runs Bell goes for a drive outside off and this skews off a thickish outside edge behind point, he picks up a couple of runs
McKay to Bell, 1 wide plenty of swing here for McKay but again it's too much movement - this one curves too wide of off and is called a wide
McKay to Bell, no run outswing again but not quite as wide and Bell just watches this through to Haddin
McKay to Bell, no run more accurate now as McKay probes on off stump and Bell defends a short-of-a-length delivery
McKay to Bell, no run Bell comes forward now and ends up just defending this back towards McKay
Johnson to Cook, no run accurate immediately at 140kph, Cook defends this from off stump

Johnson to Cook, 1 wide and Johnson now finds what McKay has already discovered - it ain't easy controlling this swing. This one curves well wide of off and almost to first slip. Wide signalled by umpire John Ward, who is on his ODI debut
Johnson to Cook, no run beaten outside off! Lovely delivery, just moves away enough to beat the bat of Cook, who was dabbing at this
Johnson to Cook, no run outside off stump again and this one Cook leaves alone
Johnson to Cook, no run Johnson goes fuller, aiming for the yorker at 146kph, but it's not quite full enough for a yorker and Cook pushes to leg
Johnson to Cook, 2 runs Cook gets some width now and it's a touch shorter, he's happy to punch this through cover and pick up a couple more runs
Johnson to Cook, no run this one swings in just a touch and Cook defends solidly towards off
McKay to Bell, no run McKay moves this in to the right-hander Bell, who defends
McKay to Bell, no run Bell leans out to defend once more, he's making a watchful start

McKay to Bell, no run a shout from the Australians here as this one swings down leg and Bell goes for a glance, Haddin makes a diving take. Umpire Dharmasena says not out, but also doesn't signal wide, indicating perhaps that was off thigh pad. Replays suggest it may have missed everything - McKay probably lucky that wasn't called wide
McKay to Bell, 1 leg bye worked away to the leg side
McKay to Cook, no run Cook is defending off the back foot now
McKay to Cook, 1 run on the pads now and Cook flicks it away towards fine leg, just ticking the scoreboard over gently at this stage

Johnson to Cook, no run again Johnson beats Cook outside off! Really had him squared up here, angled in towards off and just straightening enough, Cook's feet go nowhere and he's lucky not to edge this
Johnson to Cook, FOUR runs Cook picks up the first boundary of the innings, just a casual sort of flick through square leg as Johnson gives him one on middle and leg
Johnson to Cook, 1 run steered away towards fine leg and Faulkner does the fielding
Johnson to Bell, 1 run Johnson bangs this one in short and Bell works it away off the body behind square, awkward delivery
Johnson to Cook, no run solidly defended by Cook
Johnson to Cook, no run left alone outside off as Johnson gives Cook a bit more width
Coulter-Nile to Bell, 1 run cut away behind point for a single
Coulter-Nile to Cook, no run Cook cuts hard but finds point
Coulter-Nile to Cook, no run Cook again goes for the cut but this one beats the bat - Coulter-Nile giving him a little width here
Coulter-Nile to Cook, 1 run on the pads now and Cook is easily able to work this to fine leg for a single
Coulter-Nile to Bell, no run on off stump now and Bell defends
Coulter-Nile to Bell, 1 run shortish and wideish and cuttish to third mannish
Johnson to Bell, no run Johnson bangs it in towards the hips, Bell just works it down towards leg

Johnson to Bell, no run bouncer, nice and accurate too but Bell is keen to play, tries to sway back and steer it over the cordon but doesn't connect - Johnson is interested in a caught behind appeal but Haddin isn't
Johnson to Bell, FOUR runs Bell has had enough of waiting around, he flashes outside off and crunches Johnson uppishly through cover for his first boundary
Johnson to Bell, no run Bell drives hard again, this time along the ground and straight to mid-off
Johnson to Bell, no run nearly played on! Bell defends outside off and this skews off the inside edge just past the stumps - that was close!
Johnson to Bell, 1 run fuller from Johnson and that allows Bell to play that late cut that he enjoys, just steers this safely along the ground to third man
Coulter-Nile to Bell, no run Bell launches at this, tries to drive Coulter-Nile through mid-off but finds the fielder
Coulter-Nile to Bell, 3 runs width from Coulter-Nile and Bell is keen to go after him, throws the bat at this and lobs him over cover but the ball pulls up well inside the boundary
Coulter-Nile to Cook, 3 runs now Cook is taking on Coulter-Nile, too, with a lovely cover drive that is chased down by McKay with a sliding save on the boundary
Coulter-Nile to Bell, FOUR runs Bell picks up a boundary this time, nice attractive shot too as he clips off his pads wide of mid-on and although it was uppishly struck it was safe, lovely placement
Coulter-Nile to Bell, 2 runs and wouldn't you know it, a slip comes out and Bell edges this one through the new gap, though angled it down so it wasn't really catchable height - third man collects
Coulter-Nile to Bell, no run defended towards the off side now
McKay to Cook, no run Cook defends a delivery that came at him at 125kph
McKay to Cook, 3 runs on the pads now and Cook waits on it, clips comfortably through midwicket but it's chased down inside the boundary by Maxwell
McKay to Bell, 1 run McKay continues at his usual high 120s speed, Bell steers this late cut safely away for another run
McKay to Cook, no run cuts hard into the turf and straight to point
McKay to Cook, no run McKay hurls this one down with a Sharapova-like grunt, Cook nudges off the pads to midwicket
McKay to Cook, FOUR runs poor ball, short and down leg side and all Cook had to do was help this on its way to fine leg - which he did. McKay is chastising himself at that delivery
Coulter-Nile to Bell, no run defended towards the off side
Coulter-Nile to Bell, no run Bell looks to smash Coulter-Nile over midwicket now but miscues away to the off side

Coulter-Nile to Bell, 1 run hmmm, Bell has nearly thrown it away here as he tries to launch it over mid-off and it lobs up in the air, Faulkner runs back from mid-off and nearly gets to it - Bell is lucky to survive there
Coulter-Nile to Cook, no run beaten outside off now as Coulter-Nile angles it across and draws Cook into the drive
Coulter-Nile to Cook, no run pushed away towards mid-off
Coulter-Nile to Cook, no run driven away to mid-off once again
McKay to Bell, no run accurate from McKay on off stump, Bell just defends after a couple of more adventurous swings at Coulter-Nile last over
McKay to Bell, no run Bell walks down the pitch, keen to get the scoreboard moving further, McKay drags the length back and makes Bell defend
McKay to Bell, 1 wide horribly wide of off now, McKay has done this a few times today, just squirting it far too wide

McKay to Bell, FOUR runs now Bell gets some width and goes with it, takes a swing at McKay and scoops this up over point and the ball runs away to the boundary, confident shot and well executed by Bell

McKay to Bell, 2 runs he continues to have a real crack does Bell, tries the big aerial straight drive and doesn't quite middle it, Bailey running back from mid-on can't quite get there in time and has to content himself with keeping it to two runs
McKay to Bell, no run left alone outside off
McKay to Bell, no run Bell walks at McKay again and defends
Faulkner to Cook, no run starts at 132kph and fullish outside off, Cook drives to mid-off
Faulkner to Cook, 1 run Faulkner hurries in again, he almost looks like he's trying to sneak up on the batsman with his quick action, Cook works it away to square leg
Faulkner to Bell, 1 run Bell cuts hard when he gets some width, Maxwell does the fielding out on the point boundary
Faulkner to Cook, 1 run Cook drags one from wide of off through midwicket now, made that ball go through the gap he'd identified, though the two runs he wanted can't happen
Faulkner to Bell, no run fuller on the pads, Bell pushes to leg
Faulkner to Bell, 1 run late cut again, Bell does love that shot, and it continues to bring him safe runs
Maxwell to Bell, 1 run tossed up on the pads and Bell works it through midwicket

Maxwell to Cook, OUT Maxwell strikes! Around the wicket to Cook, who drives at a half-volley but does nothing more than send it back in the direction of the bowler, who takes a sharp catch low to his right. Cook will be kicking himself!
Maxwell to Root, no run Root drives but can't beat point - there's a really tight field inside the ring to try to keep Root on strike
Maxwell to Root, 2 runs Root is a touch lucky here, gets it away fine off the toe of the bat to get himself off the mark
Maxwell to Root, no run driven down towards mid-on
Maxwell to Root, no run fullish from Maxwell, not giving it time to turn, Root drives to mid-off with a clunky sort of sound
Johnson to Bell, 1 run soft hands from Bell as he just guides this one through square leg for a single
Johnson to Root, no run accurate at 143kph and Root defends
Johnson to Root, no run uppishly driven, very uppishly driven towards mid-off and Root is fortunate he didn't get a fraction more on that as it's bounced just short of the fielder

Johnson to Root, OUT Johnson gets Root! It seemed inevitable, and it's an lbw that gets him. Johnson gets this one to swing back in a fraction, at pace, and the only thing as slow as Root's attempt to get the bat down in time is Dharmasena's delayed decision to give that out. As he did in the first ODI, Root wants a review and as was the case then, he is still out. It was an umpire's call, replays suggestin
Johnson to Ballance, 1 wide swings this one down leg
Johnson to Ballance, no run shortish at 142kph but it's outside off, so Ballance isn't in danger - though he dabbed the bat at it perhaps unnecessarily
Maxwell to Bell, 1 run tossed up on the stumps from around the wicket, Bell now with two partners gone is happy to just work this through midwicket
Maxwell to Ballance, no run very full from Maxwell, Ballance drives at it but mistimes it towards short cover
Maxwell to Ballance, 1 run tossed up more this time and a touch of turn, Ballance nudges a single past short cover now
Maxwell to Bell, no run quicker and angled across Bell, who defends
Maxwell to Bell, 1 run Maxwell strays onto the pads now and Bell comfortably flicks a single through square leg
Maxwell to Ballance, no run again Maxwell tosses it up and tries to draw Ballance into the drive, he does go at it but mistimes
Clarke to Bell, 1 run nearly strikes immediately! Tossed up outside off and Bell pushes at it, the inside edge just misses the stumps!
Clarke to Ballance, no run on the back foot, crunched to short cover
Clarke to Ballance, 1 run Clarke is tossing this up, slowly, and Ballance drives down through mid-on
Clarke to Bell, 1 run Bell uses the feet now and just drives a safe single down to long-on
Clarke to Ballance, 1 run driven through midwicket for another single
Clarke to Bell, 2 runs tossed up wide of off, Bell was advancing and had to adjust for the width and turn, did well in the end to steer through point and pick up a couple of runs
Maxwell to Ballance, 1 run turns this one to the leg side for a single
Maxwell to Bell, 1 run this delivery heading down the leg side to backward square
Maxwell to Ballance, no run defended on the front foot by Ballance
Maxwell to Ballance, 1 run drills this one straight to silly mid-off, who makes a valiant dive to stop it
Maxwell to Bell, 1 run plays this away to the off side
Maxwell to Ballance, 1 run driven straight down the ground to the fielder at long-off to end the over
Clarke to Ballance, no run bowls one on a length which is defended to the leg side
Clarke to Ballance, no run looks for the gap through the off side, but finds the fielder
Clarke to Ballance, no run this time looking to get past silly mid-on, but the fielder is equal to the task
Clarke to Ballance, no run played to the off side, but no run on offer
Clarke to Ballance, no run once again played to the same man as Ballance is itching for a single
Clarke to Ballance, 1 run played off the back foot as this is worked away to backward square for a single
Maxwell to Ballance, 2 runs pitches this a bit wider as he drives this straight to the man at sweeper cover, with the pair able to complete a couple

Maxwell to Ballance, OUT and Maxwell beats an increasingly fidgety Ballance as he lofts one just around off stump, with the flight drawing Ballance down the track before the left-hander, trying to work this leg side, misses the ball completely, and turns around just in time to see Haddin collect the ball and whip the bails off. Maxwell strikes again and suddenly England seemed to have lost their way at 78 f
Maxwell to Morgan, no run lets the keeper collect this one as it spins away from the bat
Maxwell to Morgan, 1 run steers this one down to long-off for a single
Maxwell to Bell, no run on the back foot to negotiate this back of a length offering carefully back to the bowler
Maxwell to Bell, 1 run works this one off the pads to bring the over to an end
Clarke to Bell, no run defended away to the off side by Bell

Clarke to Bell, 1 run advances down the track to this tossed up delivery, with Bell looking to hit through mid-off, but instead hits it straight back to Clarke, who gets a touch on it as it just misses the non-striker's stumps, with Morgan backing up a bit too much, and was well short of his ground

Clarke to Morgan, (no ball) 1 run down the track and Morgan figures he has got a handle on the pitch as he looks to clear midwicket with a big hit, but instead gets this to go higher than farther, with deep midwicket steadying himself under it to take the catch. Morgan has made an inquiry with the umpire about the fact that there are too many fielders outside of the circle. Currently verifying if this is
Clarke to Bell, 1 run turned away to square leg for a single
Clarke to Morgan, 1 run once again worked to square leg for one
Clarke to Bell, no run tries to hit this past the off side, but its just not going to happen
Clarke to Bell, no run defends this last one carefully to see an end to quite an entertaining over
Maxwell to Morgan, 1 run
Maxwell to Bell, no run defended with a straight bat back to the bowler
Maxwell to Bell, 1 run a little shorter as this is whisked off the pads to the fielder at deep square leg
Maxwell to Morgan, no run rocks forward to defend this latest offering from Maxwell
Maxwell to Morgan, 1 run helped off the pads to the leg side for one
Maxwell to Bell, 2 runs drags this on leg stump as Bell picks his gap before rocking back to play a short-arm pull to deep midwicket, but doesn't get enough on it for it to clear the boundary
Clarke to Morgan, 1 run manages to manufacture a flick off a shortish length behind square
Clarke to Bell, 1 run in the slot and driven down to long-off for a single
Clarke to Morgan, 1 run eases this fuller one to the same man who is able to rein it in
Clarke to Bell, no run already in position for a front foot defence as this is played back to the bowler
Clarke to Bell, no run afforded a little bit of width as he tries to cut this away past backward point
Clarke to Bell, 2 runs a little bit short and wide as this is cut away to point for a quick-run two
Maxwell to Morgan, no run helped off the back foot to square leg
Maxwell to Morgan, 1 run clipped off the pads to square leg for one
Maxwell to Bell, 1 run thinks about leaving this one outside off before playing a shot to it
Maxwell to Morgan, 1 run negotiated to the leg side with soft hands
Maxwell to Bell, 1 run carves this to the off side with a push to bring up a well-played fifty, his 28th of his career
Maxwell to Morgan, 1 run too short and wide as this is cut away to backward point for the easiest of singles. Also brings up the England 100 as well
McKay to Morgan, 1 run shortish length which is helped off the pads to the leg side
McKay to Bell, 1 run back of a length which bounces higher than Bell expected as this catches the outside edge and spoons to the off side, but luckily there are no fielders in the vicinity
McKay to Morgan, no run pushes this tentatively to the off side and sets off for a single, but when he sees the incoming fielder, decides to turn around and dive back to make his ground
McKay to Morgan, 1 run played with the softest of hands near the body on the off side for a quick single
McKay to Bell, 2 runs clipped off the pads down to deep midwicket for a brace
McKay to Bell, 1 run shortish length played with soft hands to the off side off the back foot
Maxwell to Bell, 1 leg bye tosses this up quite full as Bell employs the sweep, but misses the ball. Ends up running the leg-bye
Maxwell to Morgan, no run defended stoically on the front foot by Morgan
Maxwell to Morgan, 1 run a bit shorter as Morgan is able to cut this away through point for one
Maxwell to Bell, 1 run worked off the back foot as he almost plays the wrong line
Maxwell to Morgan, no run tries for the bunt once more, but fails to get it away
Maxwell to Morgan, 1 run this time finds the gap through the off side for a single
McKay to Morgan, no run shortish length which is defended off the back foot by Morgan
McKay to Morgan, no run on the back foot again as this is worked down to the man at mid-off
McKay to Morgan, 1 run full and in the slot as Morgan drives this down to deep extra-cover for a couple
McKay to Bell, FOUR runs a short, slower bouncer from McKay which has Bell going through his pull quite early, with the ball top-edging right over the keeper's head to the boundary
McKay to Bell, no run what a jaffa from McKay! this one 10 kph quicker as it rises off a length, with Bell getting tantalizing close to it as he tries to play a ramp over the slip region
McKay to Bell, 1 run steers this one just outside off to third man for a single
Maxwell to Bell, 1 run eased down to the man at long-on for a single
Maxwell to Morgan, no run gets forward to defend this latest offering back to Maxwell
Maxwell to Morgan, no run driven straight to the man at extra-cover as Morgan looks for the gap
Maxwell to Morgan, no run once again fails to find it as he plays this one straight to backward point
Maxwell to Morgan, 1 run fired in on leg as this is worked down to long-on
Maxwell to Bell, 1 run clipped off the pads to the leg side to retain the strike
McKay to Bell, 1 run slanting delivery which is helped to the leg side by Bell
McKay to Morgan, SIX runs and the first six of the innings is brought to you by Morgan as he shimmies down the track before clubbing McKay right back over long-on with the easiest of swings
McKay to Morgan, no run defended on the front foot
McKay to Morgan, 1 run cuts this away to the man at point
McKay to Bell, no run steered down to the man at midwicket
McKay to Bell, no run plays this off the back foot back to McKay to bring the 27th over to an end
Faulkner to Morgan, no run starts off with a ball on a length which is defended to the off side
Faulkner to Morgan, no run plays this shortish length delivery with soft hands to the man at backward point
Faulkner to Morgan, 2 runs able to slice this length ball outside off to third man
Faulkner to Morgan, no run tries to get this past silly mid-on, but the fielder makes a great diving effort to save the run

Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run too full from Faulkner as Morgan punches this straight back, with Faulkner getting his finger tips on it, with Bell short of his crease, but the ball evades the stumps once again. Second time that has happened this innings
Faulkner to Bell, no run defended with soft hands to the off side by Bell
Johnson to Morgan, no run shortish length which is defended back to the bowler
Johnson to Morgan, 1 run short and wide as this is cut away in front of square to the fielder
Johnson to Bell, no run fuller one which is safely negotiated by Bell
Johnson to Bell, no run cuts this one away, with the hope of getting it past backward point, but the fielder is equal to the task
Johnson to Bell, no run fires in a bouncer which Bell thinks about ramping, before bending his back to get away from the line
Johnson to Bell, 1 wide fuller one which swings away as Bell decides to let it go, and a good decision by him as this is called a wide
Johnson to Bell, no run finishes well as this back of a length delivery into the ribs is played back to the bowler
Faulkner to Morgan, no run bowls a length ball which is defended to the off side

Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run plays this one with soft hands behind square as the pair are able to complete a run laced with danger, as Warner makes a quick-release throw at the striker's end, with Bell well short of his crease
Faulkner to Bell, FOUR runs is afforded enough room to squeeze this away past backward point to the boundary. Was so close to the fielder, but it looks like the fielder had not picked it early
Faulkner to Bell, 1 run in the same area as this one is run down to the man at third man
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run overpitches and is met with a full face drive past the bowler to the man at long-on

Faulkner to Bell, OUT in the blockhole as Bell plays this with soft hands before setting off for one. He is turned back immediately by Morgan when he sees Clarke advancing on it, who picks it up and fires in a throw which has Bell diving for safety, but the bat bounces off the pitch as he looks to ground it. The throw beats Bell's dive handsomely, and just like that Bell is gone for a well-fought 68
Johnson to Morgan, no run defended solidly by Morgan on the front foot
Johnson to Morgan, no run thuds into Morgan's pads as he looks for the flick
Johnson to Morgan, no run fires in a bouncer outside off which is left alone by the batsman
Johnson to Morgan, no run short and wide and cut away to the man at backward point
Johnson to Morgan, no run fuller one which is defended back to Johnson
Johnson to Morgan, 1 run short of a length delivery going down the leg side as Morgan attempts to play this past the keeper down the leg side
McKay to Morgan, FOUR runs and he is met first up with a cheeky glance to this leg side delivery which has Haddin caught out as he looks to collect the ball from the off side
McKay to Morgan, no run defends this next one rather carefully to the off side
McKay to Morgan, no run short of a length which is allowed through to the keeper
McKay to Morgan, no run short of a length which is defended to the off side
McKay to Morgan, 1 run drives this next one down to long-off for an easy single
McKay to Bopara, FOUR runs plays a lovely straight drive which is timed with such ease that it beats the two fielders converging on it quite comfortably
Johnson to Morgan, no run fuller one which is steered straight to silly mid-off
Johnson to Morgan, 2 runs short of a length which is pulled behind square for a brace. Wasn't in complete control of that shot
Johnson to Morgan, 1 run overpitched and driven down the ground, but doesn't get the timing quite right on this one
Johnson to Bopara, no run short bouncer going down the leg side as Bopara doesn't offer a shot. I think he was banking on the umpire giving it a wide, but the hands are unmoved
Johnson to Bopara, no run bowls a steepler which has Bopara dropping his wrists
Johnson to Bopara, 1 wide length pitched wide outside off as this time the umpire is snapped back into attention as he signals a wide
Johnson to Bopara, 1 run fires a yorker outside off which is steered to the off side
Faulkner to Bopara, no run punched straight to the fielder at cover, which is greeted with a roar as the crowd think they have got a wicket, but it was hit into the ground before it carried
Faulkner to Bopara, no run defended again to the off side by Bopara
Faulkner to Bopara, 1 run able to get away this back of a length delivery which sits up to the leg side
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run full from Faulkner which is eased down to long-on for one
Faulkner to Bopara, no run carved straight to point, who does well to get behind this one
Faulkner to Bopara, 1 run strikes him on the pads, but it looks like he got an inside edge as the ball pops to the off side
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, no run bangs it in short and Bopara steers to backward point, wants a single but is sent back and fortunately, as David Warner was sharp in the field though no direct hit
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, 2 runs wristy flick off the pads now through square leg and he picks up a couple of runs
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, 1 run on the back foot now Bopara punches through point
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, 1 run accurate from Coulter-Nile, Morgan just drops it towards off and gets through for a quick single
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, 1 run Bopara again punches through cover off the back foot
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run accurate again on middle and off and this time Morgan defends
Faulkner to Bopara, FOUR runs and immediately the field change brings a boundary, Bopara goes the pull and his under-edge runs past the short fine leg and away to the boundary
Faulkner to Bopara, 1 run angled across Bopara, who drives down to long-off
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run tip and run from Morgan, who just nudges a single towards point
Faulkner to Bopara, 1 run ticks the scoreboard over again with another drive to long-off
Faulkner to Morgan, no run Morgan tries to get adventurous by shimmying down and across outside off, but it's yorker length and he can't get the ball through the field
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run another bunt to the off side and another single
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run again Morgan tries to create something, walks down the pitch and across off stump, but his dab misses the ball
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run Morgan has a slash again outside off, again this one misses the bat
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run right on line now and Morgan defends, he's having trouble getting the ball away just at the moment
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, 1 run tries to force the issue now and crunches it down past the bowler but mid-off gets across to cut this off
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, SIX runs Bopara gets hold of this one! Lovely timing as he hits through the line and lifts Coulter-Nile over long-on for six, just a really clean strike
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, 1 run pulls this forward of square

Faulkner to Bopara, OUT Bopara's gone! He's tried to flick Faulkner through the leg side but has managed only to chip it up to George Bailey at short midwicket, straightforward catch and England are in a spot of bother now
Faulkner to Buttler, no run Buttler starts with a straight-bat defence as Faulkner targets middle and leg
Faulkner to Buttler, no run drives down towards mid-on and can't beat the field
Faulkner to Buttler, 1 run off the mark with a late cut, just waits on this and steers a single to third man
Faulkner to Morgan, no run Faulkner goes for the yorker now and Morgan can only push it back in the direction from which it came

Faulkner to Morgan, FOUR runs Morgan tries to lift the tempo while the field is up, and he gets away with a boundary. He backed away and swung hard outside off, his thickish edge flew over the infield and bounced away to the boundary
Coulter-Nile to Buttler, 1 wide Coulter-Nile goes the bouncer and this one has been called a wide - just a touch too high
Coulter-Nile to Buttler, no run again Coulter-Nile goes short, this time outside off and not quite as high, Buttler shapes to play and then leaves it alone
Coulter-Nile to Buttler, 1 run quick single as Buttler nudges this to off, he's a little hesitant at first but gets to the bowler's end in time to beat Bailey's direct hit
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run cut away towards backward point and Morgan can't find the gap
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run Morgan looks to open the shoulders and smash this through midwicket, can't quite get it where he wants it though and finds mid-on
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, 1 run good length from Coulter-Nile means Morgan can't do much except steer this to third man for a single
Coulter-Nile to Buttler, 2 runs this one stays a touch low and Buttler does well to nudge a couple through midwicket
Faulkner to Morgan, 2 runs nicely placed from Morgan as he brings up his half-century with a drive through the gap at extra cover
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run steered off the face of the bat towards backward point
Faulkner to Buttler, 1 run Buttler uses the angle to work it through square leg
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run Morgan backs off a touch and tries to force a yorker through cover, finds the fielder but also a single
Faulkner to Buttler, 2 runs again the angle helps Buttler work this through midwicket but the boundary is protected so he can only pick up two
Faulkner to Buttler, 1 run drives down towards long-on
Johnson to Buttler, 1 run Buttler turns this off his hips towards square leg

Johnson to Morgan, no run interesting, no wide call from the umpire now as Morgan goes for a hook to a ball down leg - that was a long way down so the umpire must have felt there was some glove on that. Don't think there was - in any case it bounced short of Haddin
Johnson to Morgan, 1 wide well, this one has been called wide now, a bouncer that is probably just a touch too high as Morgan ducks
Johnson to Morgan, 2 runs Morgan is in busy Michael Hussey-mode here as he pushes through cover and calls and runs quickly, hares back for a second run
Johnson to Morgan, no run defended back towards Johnson
Johnson to Morgan, 1 leg bye swinging down leg but the pad of Morgan gets in the way, and he picks up a leg bye
Johnson to Buttler, 1 run slower now at 132kph and Buttler pushes to leg and takes a single
McKay to Buttler, 2 runs worked away through square leg for a couple of runs
McKay to Buttler, 2 runs McKay tries for the outside-off line but Buttler is good enough to whip it through leg for two more
McKay to Buttler, 3 runs Buttler decides he's seen enough and backs away, lifts McKay over cover but didn't quite have the timing for it to reach the boundary
McKay to Morgan, 1 run Morgan advances down the pitch but has to adjust his stroke and settles for a quick single nudged to point
McKay to Buttler, 2 runs again Buttler uses the wrists nicely to flick this behind square from an off-stump line and his running is sharp enough to make that two
McKay to Buttler, 1 run again Buttler works it through leg, makes it a pretty productive over - 10 off it with no boundaries
Johnson to Buttler, FOUR runs Buttler goes over the top now and doesn't quite time it, but had enough muscle behind it to get it away to the boundary at midwicket
Johnson to Buttler, 1 run slower bouncer now from Johnson and Buttler shapes to hook, then adjusts and settles for a single to leg
Johnson to Morgan, SIX runs super shot! Morgan has had a real crack at Johnson here, uses the pace of the ball and whacks this over cover with such timing that it has cleared the boundary!
Johnson to Morgan, 1 run Johnson goes fuller now and Morgan drives through point
Johnson to Buttler, 1 run Buttler goes back in his crease and gets a single to third man off a thickish edge
Johnson to Morgan, 1 run Johnson goes for the yorker but Morgan is good enough to work it behind square for a single
Faulkner to Morgan, 2 runs Morgan lifts this over wide midwicket and it's well timed but reeled in on the boundary
Faulkner to Morgan, no run Morgan advances but his drive can't beat cover

Faulkner to Morgan, SIX runs powerful shot! Morgan has crunched Faulkner over long-on with such good timing and strength that it's made it ten rows back in the crowd, he could really get England's total moving here
Faulkner to Morgan, FOUR runs another boundary, this time he's manouevred it through square leg where there is a gap
Faulkner to Morgan, no run good yorker - Morgan can't do anything but keep that out
Faulkner to Morgan, 2 runs tries for another heave through leg but doesn't quite time this one well enough to reach the square leg boundary
Coulter-Nile to Buttler, no run Buttler backs off and tries to force but can't beat the field
Coulter-Nile to Buttler, 1 run goes for the bouncer now and Buttler's hook bounces out to Warner at deep midwicket
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, 1 run Morgan backs away now and can't middle it, just gets a single down towards long-off
Coulter-Nile to Buttler, no run yet again Buttler tries to create space by backing away but Coulter-Nile does well to adjust and follows him, gives him no room and Buttler can only keep it out

Coulter-Nile to Buttler, 1 run oh dear, Coulter-Nile has missed the chance for a wicket - by dropping the catch himself! Buttler has top-edged and this ball flies high into the off side, Bailey comes in and seems to want the catch but Coulter-Nile calls it, then seems to be in position but grasses the chance - then grasses himself, kneeling on the ground in anguish
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, SIX runs huge six! Morgan has timed this one magnificently, launched it way over the long-off boundary to add insult to injury for Coulter-Nile
Faulkner to Buttler, 1 run good yorker and all Buttler can do is push it through the off side
Faulkner to Morgan, SIX runs Morgan is on fire here! He's whipped a full toss off the middle-and-leg line and helped it on its way over square leg for six

Faulkner to Morgan, SIX runs another six! Morgan has 96 now and this is the biggest six of the lot, he has launched an enormous swipe over midwicket to the long boundary - and it's gone many, many rows back into the crowd
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run he won't get the hundred just yet, forces a single through cover
Faulkner to Buttler, no run good yorker now as Faulkner gets the length right, Buttler pushes it back to him
Faulkner to Buttler, FOUR runs this yorker is not quite right though, just a fraction too short and Buttler slaps this half-volley over extra cover for four more runs
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, 1 run Morgan gets a low full toss but can't quite find the gap, picks up a single on the bounce to deep midwicket
Coulter-Nile to Buttler, 1 run Buttler backs away and takes a swing, doesn't time it and gets a single to long-on
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run Morgan times this but doesn't place it, finds the man at mid-off

Coulter-Nile to Morgan, FOUR runs what a way to bring up the hundred! Morgan gets a shortish ball and simply - well, he makes it look simple - helps it on its way over the keeper's head where it bounces away to the boundary. That's his sixth ODI century and he's put England on track for a hefty total
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, 1 run takes a swing at this through leg but just a single
Coulter-Nile to Buttler, 1 leg bye once again Coulter-Nile does well to follow Buttler as he backs away, can only manage a leg bye

Johnson to Buttler, no run Buttler tries to get fancy but it doesn't work, he's walked across well outside leg and tried to scoop it over Haddin, but doesn't manage to get hold of it and Haddin gloves the ball

Johnson to Buttler, SIX runs this one Buttler plays more conventionally, thumps it down the ground towards long-off and that looks to be clearing the rope - Marsh steps over the rope and jumps and pushes the ball back in. Hmm, he launched himself from outside the field of play and was in the air when he touched the ball to force it back into play. That must be six, surely? And has been changed subsequently
Johnson to Buttler, 1 wide wide of off
Johnson to Buttler, 2 runs crunched away through midwicket now and Maxwell dives to reel it in inside the boundary
Johnson to Buttler, FOUR runs Buttler gets lucky now as he swipes hard and a top edge flies over the head of Haddin for four more
Johnson to Buttler, 2 runs struck down the ground and that's just a single
Johnson to Buttler, 1 run crunched through midwicket for another single
Coulter-Nile to Buttler, no run well bowled by Coulter-Nile, Buttler back off and Coulter-Nile went wide of off to keep the ball out of his reach
Coulter-Nile to Buttler, 2 wide down leg this time as Coulter-Nile tries to follow the batsman but goes too far
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, 1 run thumped through the leg side now

Coulter-Nile to Buttler, OUT Buttler skies this one and Clarke runs in from mid-on, appears at first to misjudge it and has to dive forward a bit but does indeed complete the catch, so Coulter-Nile gets the wicket he missed earlier, and England lose their sixth wicket, but Buttler has done a fine job
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, 1 run Morgan jams down on a yorker and forces a single through off
Coulter-Nile to Stokes, OUT Stokes is gone first ball! He's tried to launch this over the leg side and finds the man at deep midwicket, another one for Coulter-Nile
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, 1 run worked away through the leg side

Faulkner to Morgan, OUT Morgan gets a low full toss and miscues it, finds the man at deep mid-off and that's the end of a wonderful innings of 106, Morgan has really given England's bowlers a strong target to defend
Faulkner to Bresnan, 1 run Bresnan takes a swing and picks up a single through leg side
Faulkner to Jordan, no run Jordan gets a slower bouncer and can't put bat on ball
Faulkner to Jordan, no run again he can't put bat on a short ball
Faulkner to Jordan, no run again Faulkner goes short and again Jordan can't hit it
Faulkner to Jordan, 2 runs Jordan swipes and does make contact with this one, picks up two through the leg side despite a tight call with Bresnan completing the second at the non-striker's end

So England have finished with 8 for 296, leaving Australia chasing 297 for victory. (Note: After the innings break this was updated to 8 for 300 due to an umpiring error that called ball 47.2 a two, when it should have been a six). What a fantastic innings from Eoin Morgan, his hundred was the difference between a sub-par total and something much more competitive. Australia thought they had him cheaply when he was

We are back live at the Gabba. It will be Rankin to bowl to Warner. And during the break the match officials have made a correction to England's score. It's up to 300 and Buttler's score is now 49. That's because the ball at 47.2, when Shaun Marsh stepped outside the boundary and knocked the ball back in play, was not called a six when it should have been. The officials have now rectified that.
Rankin to Warner, 2 runs and Warner starts it off with a flash to this shortish length outside off which is played to extra-cover
Rankin to Warner, no run defended off the back foot by Warner
Rankin to Warner, no run just works this back of a length delivery to the leg side
Rankin to Warner, 3 runs pushed on the back foot as this is pulled square, with the ball almost reaching the boundary
Rankin to Finch, no run back of a length which is defended carefully off the back foot by Finch
Rankin to Finch, no run gets solidly behind this fuller one from Rankin to end the over
Jordan to Warner, no run fuller length delivery pitched on the leg stump and swinging in a bit, Warner is hit high on the pads, that was going down and over the top
Jordan to Warner, 1 run slightly shorter on off, Warner pulls it to mid on
Jordan to Marsh, 3 runs full and wide and Marsh just caresses this beautifully through point for a well-timed drive
Jordan to Warner, no run punches this one straight to the cover fielder
Jordan to Warner, no run tries to slap this away in front of square, but cover is back into play
Rankin to Marsh, no run pushes this across Warner as he chooses to exercise restraint
Rankin to Marsh, 1 wide short and going down the leg side as Warner leaves this well alone
Rankin to Marsh, no run once again left
Rankin to Marsh, no run leans into a full-bloodied square drive which just races across the grass to the sweeper boundary
Rankin to Marsh, FOUR runs
Rankin to Marsh, no run once again lets this steepler outside off rise to the keeper
Rankin to Marsh, no run defended cautiously to the leg side to end the over
Jordan to Warner, FOUR runs first ball from Jordan and just hammered back to long-off by Warner who is in a mood to attack
Jordan to Warner, 1 run pushes this back of a length delivery to the off side to set off for a quick single
Jordan to Marsh, no run Jordan tries him with a shorter one which Marsh looks to pull, but is late on as the ball hits him in the stomach. Didn't show too much pain after so all is well
Jordan to Marsh, no run directs this full and wide delivery to the fielder at silly mid-off
Jordan to Marsh, no run bowls one which goes across him as Marsh ends up playing it back to the bowler
Jordan to Marsh, no run back of a length which climbs appreciably as Marsh decides to leave it alone
Rankin to Warner, 3 runs fuller one which is driven to deep midwicket by Warner, but not hit will enough for it to reach the boundary
Rankin to Marsh, no run decides to shoulder arms to this next one going across him
Rankin to Marsh, no run drives this full length one to the fielder at long-off
Rankin to Marsh, FOUR runs wide and in the slot as Marsh is given the freedom to use his arms and just drill this to the extra-cover boundary for four
Rankin to Marsh, 1 run pushes this fuller one to the off side for a quick single
Rankin to Warner, FOUR runs Warner just crunches this fuller one from Rankin straight back over the bowler's head for a boundary
Jordan to Marsh, no run content to shoulder arms to this 139 kph delivery from Jordan
Jordan to Marsh, no run thinks about a shot before defending this riser from Jordan on the back foot

Jordan to Marsh, 1 run another full one, this time on the pads, as Marsh looks for the clip, but ends up being hit outside the line. Marsh presses on for the run, and is lucky to make his ground before the throw from the mid-off fielder. Was very tough and go that one
Jordan to Warner, no run surprises Warner with a short one which has him ducking for cover

Jordan to Warner, OUT Jordan takes a spectacular return catch to remove the dangerous Warner as the left-hander hammers back a length ball to the right of Jordan, who instinctively stretches out his hand to grab hold of the chance. Amazing that it even managed to stick, especially with how hard Warner had struck that back. Removes a dangerous thorn in the backside for the English
Jordan to Clarke, no run back of a length which Clarke gets successfully behind the line of
Rankin to Marsh, no run happy to shoulder arms to this riser going outside off
Rankin to Marsh, 1 run manages to work this back of a length delivery on the pads for a single
Rankin to Clarke, 1 run short and wide as this is cut away behind point
Rankin to Marsh, no run gets forward to this full one from Rankin as the ball rolls to the off side
Rankin to Marsh, no run on the back foot and defended back to the bowler
Rankin to Marsh, no run full and on the pads as Marsh fails to get this away
Jordan to Clarke, FOUR runs too short from Jordan on this track as Clarke seems to have all eternity to pick his spot and pull this through midwicket for a boundary
Jordan to Clarke, no run gets his line and length on a better spot, but Clarke still looking to be aggressive as this is slapped away to the off side
Jordan to Clarke, no run defends this length ball from Jordan with ease
Jordan to Clarke, 2 runs plays a pick-up pull shot of sorts which is helped down to fine leg for a brace
Jordan to Clarke, FOUR runs short and wide and Jordan is punished as Clarke cuts this brutally through the vacant gap at point to the boundary
Jordan to Clarke, no run length outside off which is shouldered arms to
Bresnan to Marsh, no run starts off with a loosener which is played straight to cover, who does well to field it
Bresnan to Marsh, no run defended off the back foot by Marsh to the bowler

Bresnan to Marsh, no run going down the leg side as Marsh looks for a glance down the leg side, but is late on it as it hits the thigh pad on its way to the keeper, who takes a good low catch to his right. They go for the appeal, but the umpire saw the impact on the thigh
Bresnan to Marsh, FOUR runs on to this one in a flash as he sees it short and rocks back to pull this fiercely to the midwicket boundary
Bresnan to Marsh, no run defends this next one sensibly to the leg side
Bresnan to Marsh, 1 run able to steer this one outside off to the fielder at third man
Stokes to Marsh, FOUR runs too full on the pads as this is eased comfortably to the fine leg boundary for four
Stokes to Marsh, no run drives this fuller one straight to silly mid-off
Stokes to Marsh, no run this time directs it to the man at silly mid-on, as they continue to look for an opportunity to score
Stokes to Marsh, no run defends this one swinging in on him to the right of the bowler
Stokes to Marsh, no run rocks forward to defend this latest offering from Stokes
Stokes to Marsh, FOUR runs too short from Stokes and Marsh punishes him with a pull shot to midwicket. Stokes struggling to get his lines right here
Bresnan to Clarke, no run length ball coming in to the batsman as Clarke is resolute in defence
Bresnan to Clarke, 1 run pushed onto the back foot to play this away to the leg side
Bresnan to Marsh, no run defended on the front foot to the bowler
Bresnan to Marsh, no run once again fails to get this away to the leg side
Bresnan to Marsh, 1 run turned off the hip to the leg side for one
Bresnan to Clarke, 1 run played to the off side for a single and to retain the strike. The throw does come in, and would have had Marsh short if he had struck down the stumps
Stokes to Clarke, no run just lasers this fuller one right back at the non-striker's stumps. Looks in glorious touch today
Stokes to Clarke, 1 run back of a length delivery outside off, Clarke cuts it away to square third man
Stokes to Marsh, no run pushed to the fielder at mid-off
Stokes to Marsh, 1 run back of a length outside off which is cut away to deep extra-cover
Stokes to Clarke, 1 run helps this one off the pads towards square leg
Stokes to Marsh, no run strikes him on the pads, but this was definitely outside the line
Bresnan to Clarke, no run gets forward to defend this offering from Bresnan
Bresnan to Clarke, 1 run helps this off the hips to square leg
Bresnan to Marsh, 1 run fuller one which is clipped to square leg for a brace
Bresnan to Clarke, no run slower short ball which Clarke decides to duck under, even though he could have gone after him
Bresnan to Clarke, 1 run banged in short outside off, Clarke swivels and pulls it away to backward square leg
Bresnan to Marsh, 1 run back of a length which is run down to short third man for a single
Root to Marsh, no run delivers a shorter one which is steered straight to silly mid-on
Root to Marsh, 2 runs drives this fuller one through deep extra-cover for a couple
Root to Marsh, 1 run pushes this off the back foot to the fielder at long-on
Root to Clarke, no run tries to guide this past Root, but the Yorkshireman dives fully to his right to get close to it
Root to Bailey, 1 run just caresses this for a single to long-on to get off the mark
Bresnan to Bailey, no run back of a length outside off which is pushed to the off side by Bailey
Bresnan to Bailey, 3 runs Bailey looks to be in good touch as he cuts this away to the off side, but doesn't have enough on it for it to reach all the way to the boundary

Bresnan to Marsh, no run Bresnan strikes Marsh on the pads as the bowler goes up for an appeal. Dharmasena is not interested though, and after a brief consultation, they decide to go for the review. The review shows that this is definitely pitching outside leg though, so in turns out be a dud review for England. Oh well
Bresnan to Marsh, 1 run shortish length which is angled down to third man, but is kept to a single only
Bresnan to Bailey, 1 run pitches this short, with the ball sitting up for Bailey, as he is able to get into his pull shot early, and then go for another swivel after for the photographers
Bresnan to Marsh, no run defended away to the off side to finish the over
Root to Bailey, 1 run fuller one which is swept to the man at fine leg
Root to Marsh, no run this one seems to rush on Marsh as he late cuts this to the fielder at backward point
Root to Marsh, 1 run this time slaps it away to the fielder at deep extra-cover
Root to Bailey, 2 runs this time steered behind square on the leg side for a brace
Root to Bailey, no run tries to get this away on the leg side, but fails to do so
Root to Bailey, no run defended to the off side to end the over
Stokes to Marsh, no run Stokes is on now, he bowls full and wide of off and Marsh drives to mid-off
Stokes to Marsh, 1 run straighter line now and Marsh only manages an inside edge onto pad and away to the leg side
Stokes to Bailey, 1 run Bailey goes back into the crease and works an easy single to deep midwicket
Stokes to Marsh, FOUR runs lovely placement and timing as Marsh waits on a late cut and picks the gap between point and gully, this races along the ground for four
Stokes to Marsh, 1 run swivels a pull through square leg now
Stokes to Bailey, 1 run Stokes tests Bailey in that avenue outside off that troubled him in the Tests, and a thickish edge runs away past slip to third man
Root to Bailey, no run Root is around the wicket to Bailey, who uses the feet and pushes to off
Root to Bailey, 1 leg bye Bailey goes for the sweep on a fullish ball and misses, there's half an lbw shout but that looked to be pitching outside leg from the angle
Root to Marsh, no run pushed to a diving cover fieldsman who keeps the batsmen in place
Root to Marsh, 1 run off-stump line and Marsh pushes a quick single which tests Bailey's groin - he gets through but perhaps a touch gingerly
Root to Bailey, no run advances and drives but can't beat mid-on
Root to Bailey, no run straight-bat defence now from Bailey
Stokes to Marsh, FOUR runs crunching drive from Marsh, this sizzles off the bat and runs along the ground between mid-off and cover for a boundary
Stokes to Marsh, 2 runs on the pads now and Marsh clips a couple through midwicket, again Bailey is able to make the runs at a sharp enough pace
Stokes to Marsh, 1 run steers a single behind point and that's the half-century for Marsh
Stokes to Bailey, no run pushed away to point
Stokes to Bailey, 1 run uses the wrists to flick this from outside off through midwicket
Stokes to Marsh, 1 wide Stokes bangs in a bouncer but it's too short - that's a wide
Stokes to Marsh, 1 run wide of off now and Marsh cuts it away towards third man
Root to Marsh, no run Root angles it in from around the wicket and Marsh pushes to cover
Root to Marsh, no run more leg-sidey now and Marsh can't quite beat the field
Root to Marsh, 1 run flat and a touch short, Marsh rocks back and cuts hard to the sweeper on the off side
Root to Bailey, 1 run Bailey uses the feet now and nudges a run through the leg side
Root to Marsh, 1 run flattish again at 95kph and Marsh whips a single to leg
Root to Bailey, 1 run down leg side from Root, Bailey glances a single
Rankin to Bailey, 2 runs Bailey works this off the pads through square leg
Rankin to Bailey, 2 runs again Bailey is able to whip through square and again he picks up two runs
Rankin to Bailey, 1 run Bailey gets a shorter one from Rankin now and pulls through square leg
Rankin to Marsh, 1 run tip and run - Marsh drops it at his feet and Bailey calls him through for a quick, but safe, single
Rankin to Bailey, 1 run straightish from Rankin and Bailey works it through leg
Rankin to Marsh, no run Marsh opens the face on this and steers it to point
Root to Bailey, 1 run Bailey goes the sweep now and gets another run off Root
Root to Marsh, 1 run drives to mid-off and there's a misfield - that's a bonus run
Root to Bailey, 1 run another run to the man in the deep on the leg side
Root to Maxwell, 1 run nudged away through leg to get off the mark
Root to Bailey, 2 runs Bailey uses the feet nicely here to rock back and cut through point, doesn't quite get it to the boundary but picks up two
Rankin to Maxwell, 1 run Rankin angles this in towards the pads of Maxwell, who flicks through square leg
Rankin to Bailey, 1 run Bailey swivels on his toes and pulls through square to keep the scoreboard ticking, but there's a lot of ticking required now
Rankin to Maxwell, no run Maxwell opens the face and tries to steer this to third man - there's a slip in place so it's risky, but he doesn't make contact at all
Rankin to Maxwell, 1 run this time Maxwell does get the open face to steer the ball down into the ground and to third man
Rankin to Bailey, no run accurate from Rankin, Bailey goes back and tries to work to leg but only gets it back to the bowler
Root to Maxwell, 1 run Maxwell pushes uppishly and shouts from the fielders as this lands just safely wide of midwicket
Root to Haddin, no run Haddin leans forward to defend his first ball
Root to Haddin, no run pushed away to the leg side again
Root to Haddin, no run again Haddin can't quite beat the field
Root to Haddin, 1 run gets off the mark now with a nudge just wide of midwicket
Root to Maxwell, 1 run forceful flick from Maxwell as he gets this through the midwicket gap
Rankin to Maxwell, 1 wide wrong line from Rankin now, this one skews down leg side and is unquestionably a wide
Rankin to Maxwell, 1 run nudged away for a quick single towards mid-on
Rankin to Haddin, no run banged in short of a length and Haddin steers it to backward point
Rankin to Haddin, no run again Haddin rocks back into the crease and can't beat point
Rankin to Haddin, no run beaten outside off, Rankin follows the shorter ones with a fuller ball that draws Haddin out and he can't get bat on ball
Rankin to Haddin, no run solidly defended by Haddin
Rankin to Haddin, no run Haddin flashes hard outside off and this fizzes past the edge and is put down by Buttler
Root to Maxwell, 1 run driven down to long-off for a single
Root to Haddin, 1 run Haddin drives for an easy single to long-on
Root to Maxwell, no run pushed away to cover but can't find the gap

Root to Maxwell, FOUR runs Maxwell gets adventurous now and it works! He's gone for the reverse ... hmm, sweep, I suppose, but it's more of a swipe that just clears square leg and runs away to the boundary
Root to Maxwell, no run pushed away to the leg side
Root to Maxwell, 1 run nudges a single through point
Jordan to Maxwell, 1 run pulled away through square leg
Jordan to Haddin, no run Haddin defends from his crease
Jordan to Haddin, 1 run Haddin squirts this away through square leg
Jordan to Maxwell, 2 runs swivels a pull through the leg side and they're quick enough to run two
Jordan to Maxwell, 2 runs Jordan gives Maxwell some width and Maxwell drives into the turf and through cover
Jordan to Maxwell, 1 leg bye tries to whip this off the hips but it runs away for a leg bye
Root to Maxwell, 1 run Root continues - and why not? - and Maxwell drives a single through midwicket
Root to Haddin, no run pushed away to leg but can't find a gap
Root to Haddin, 2 runs Haddin goes for the sweep now and Jordan collects in the deep
Root to Haddin, no run pushed away to mid-on
Root to Haddin, no run cut hard but can't beat point
Root to Haddin, 1 run nudged away behind square leg for a single
Jordan to Haddin, 2 runs Haddin goes the big swing but can't really get it away
Jordan to Haddin, no run defended edgily down into the leg
Jordan to Haddin, no run solidly defended by Haddin
Jordan to Haddin, 2 runs picks up a couple of runs now with a gentle nudge through square leg - great running
Jordan to Haddin, 1 run Haddin swings hard again and again doesn't time it through midwicket
Jordan to Maxwell, 1 run Maxwell gets a shortish one on leg and pulls it around to fine leg
Root to Maxwell, FOUR runs Maxwell goes the reverse sweep again and gets it past the man at backward point
Root to Maxwell, FOUR runs once again Maxwell picks the gap behind backward point with a reverse sweep - how does Cook stop that?
Root to Maxwell, FOUR runs he's tried it again from a full toss and this is four more! This one runs finer and there is nothing England can do to stop it
Root to Maxwell, no run tries again but this one was quicker from Root and Maxwell didn't get hold of it
Root to Maxwell, no run pushed away uppishly into the leg side
Root to Maxwell, 1 run full toss from Root and Maxwell can't put it away, just gets a single to deep midwicket
Jordan to Maxwell, 1 wide banged in short and down leg side, so that's a wide
Jordan to Maxwell, no run Maxwell takes a big swing at this on off stump and just edges it back onto the pads

Jordan to Maxwell, 2 leg byes nice ball from Jordan that nips back in off the seam and Maxwell tries to steer it to third man, but it nips in so much it strikes him on the thigh pad - Jordan asks the lbw question but it looked high
Jordan to Maxwell, no run Maxwell goes the big swipe to a short ball and can't beat midwicket
Jordan to Maxwell, 2 runs Maxwell opens the face and steers this behind point for a single to third man
Jordan to Maxwell, FOUR runs that's some intent from Maxwell! He has advanced and flat-batted this with muscle and power past mid-off for a boundary
Jordan to Maxwell, no run shorter of length and this one Maxwell can't get away
Bopara to Haddin, 1 wide ordinary start though as this one angles down leg side
Bopara to Haddin, no run pushed away to leg and no run is available
Bopara to Haddin, 1 wide down leg side again and these are all useful runs for Australia
Bopara to Haddin, no run worked away through the leg side
Bopara to Haddin, 1 run driven to cover and there's a misfield that allows a run
Bopara to Maxwell, no run pushed away to the off side
Bopara to Maxwell, FOUR runs Maxwell gets another boundary through the backward point area but not with a reverse shot this time - it's just a really well placed late cut
Bopara to Maxwell, no run defended back down the pitch
Bresnan to Haddin, 1 run Haddin starts the powerplay sedately enough, just a nudged single to mid-off

Bresnan to Maxwell, FOUR runs good timing from Maxwell, albeit from a poor delivery - low full toss just a touch down leg and Maxwell helps it on its way behind fine leg. Almost a yorker - almost, but not quite
Bresnan to Maxwell, 3 runs Maxwell hooks this one over square leg and picks up three more
Bresnan to Haddin, no run Haddin tries to force through cover but can't find the gap
Bresnan to Haddin, 2 runs shortish and Haddin pulls through square leg
Bresnan to Haddin, no run driven down to mid-off but too hard - means they can't take the single
Jordan to Maxwell, 1 leg bye leg bye is all that Maxwell can manage as Jordan aims at the leg-stump
Jordan to Haddin, no run Jordan angles this in and targets the stumps - almost gets through Haddin's defences. Actually, defences is the wrong word as he was trying a slog over leg
Jordan to Haddin, 2 runs clipped away through midwicket for another couple of runs
Jordan to Haddin, FOUR runs Haddin finds the off-side boundary now as Jordan gives him something short and wide, Haddin crunches a cut through cover point

Jordan to Haddin, FOUR runs super shot! Haddin may just be capable of rescuing Australia as he did in the Tests! He's just lifted this over extra cover and there's no man out there so if he hits it cleanly - as he did - it's a safe shot for four
Jordan to Haddin, 1 run down leg and Haddin works it away behind square
Bresnan to Maxwell, 1 run plays with soft hands to the off side as Maxwell brings up a well-played fifty. Australia will hope he can continue on longer
Bresnan to Coulter-Nile, 1 leg bye Coulter-Nile swings hard and can't get it away but they hurry through for a tight leg bye
Bresnan to Maxwell, FOUR runs Maxwell is now reversing the hook off a fast bowler! And it's worked, he's got this away for a boundary towards third man
Bresnan to Faulkner, no run pushed away to point
Jordan to Coulter-Nile, 1 wide going down the leg side as this is left alone by the batsman
Jordan to Coulter-Nile, 1 leg bye another ball angling down the pads as this comes off the thigh pad for a leg-bye
Jordan to Faulkner, no run gets his line right just outside off as Faulkner thinks about pushing at it, before retreating the bat
Jordan to Faulkner, 1 run defended with soft hands to the off side for a tight single
Jordan to Coulter-Nile, no run gets this down to backward square for one
Jordan to Coulter-Nile, 1 run fuller one down the pads which is clipped behind square on the leg side
Jordan to Faulkner, no run drives this one back to the bowler to bring the over to an end
Bresnan to Coulter-Nile, no run driven straight to mid-off by Coulter-Nile
Bresnan to Coulter-Nile, 1 run able to pull this down to deep square leg for a single
Bresnan to Faulkner, 1 run shortish length outside off which is cut towards backward point, but can't get past the fielder
Bresnan to Coulter-Nile, 2 runs back of a length and pulled down to deep midwicket

Bresnan to Coulter-Nile, SIX runs Nathan plays the most flukey hook I have ever seen as he commits early to this short of a length delivery which flies high over fine leg, with the fielder running it down, before realising it was going over
Bresnan to Coulter-Nile, 2 runs tried to pull again, but got a top-edge to third man for a couple
Bopara to Faulkner, 1 run eases this one down to long-on for oen
Bopara to Coulter-Nile, no run looks to dab this to the leg side, but the fielder is quick on it
Bopara to Coulter-Nile, no run speared in on middle and off as Nathan does well to dig it out
Bopara to Coulter-Nile, 1 run slower ball which is helped to square leg

Bopara to Faulkner, 1 run pushes this one gently to the off side with the intent to run a quick single, but is hesitant as he sees his partner turn back, but then the pair decide to risk it, and luckily enough another fumble affords Nathan that extra split-second to get in the dive
Bopara to Coulter-Nile, no run fuller one shaping in as Nathan inside-edges, but luckily away from the stumps
Stokes to Faulkner, no run drives this fuller one straight back to Stokes, who does a rolling dive to stop the ball
Stokes to Faulkner, no run tries to work this away to the leg side, but can't pinch a single
Stokes to Faulkner, 1 wide going down the leg side as the umpire calls a wide

Stokes to Faulkner, 1 run plays this softly to the man at point as they embark on a quick single, but the throw would have had the non-striker run out by miles. Morgan, after firing in the throw, grabs hold of his right knee. Hopefully he hasn't done himself in there
Stokes to Coulter-Nile, no run going down the leg side again as this time the ball strikes the pads
Stokes to Coulter-Nile, 1 leg bye this time gets it to pitch fuller as this strikes Faulkner on the toes, but hits outside the line of the stumps, despite the appeal from the bowler
Stokes to Faulkner, 1 run once again slanting down the pads as Faulkner helps this off his hops for a single
Bopara to Faulkner, 1 run back of a length coming in to the batsman as this is played to the off side
Bopara to Coulter-Nile, 1 run back of a length and punched off the back foot softly for one
Bopara to Faulkner, no run tries to carve this through the point region, but hits it straight to the fielder
Bopara to Faulkner, 1 run drives this length ball to the man at extra-cover
Bopara to Coulter-Nile, no run is solid in defence as he rocks onto the front foot
Bopara to Coulter-Nile, 1 run able to get this one just past backward point as this is played down to third man
Stokes to Coulter-Nile, 1 run another pull shot to the man at fine leg as Nathan continues to believe Australia can pull through
Stokes to Faulkner, 1 run defends this one carefully with soft hands to the off side for one
Stokes to Coulter-Nile, no run swinging down the pads as Nathan tries to get this fine down the leg side, but the keeper does well to get behind it
Stokes to Coulter-Nile, no run ends up playing this reverse-swinging delivery back to the bowler
Stokes to Coulter-Nile, no run fires in a leg side yorker which Nathan fails to get away. Really should have done better with this one

Stokes to Coulter-Nile, OUT gets one to swing in from just outside off as Nathan goes for the big heave down the ground, but misses the ball as this careens low into his right pad, which is definitely in line of the stumps. Doesn't look to have got an inside-edge as this one continued onto the pads, so fairplay to the Australians for not wasting the review
Bopara to Faulkner, no run defends this one tentatively to the off side
Bopara to Faulkner, 1 run low full toss just outside off as this is played straight to long-on
Bopara to Johnson, no run tries from round the wicket as this fuller one is defended to the off side
Bopara to Johnson, no run tries to get away a fuller one to the leg side, but silly mid-on is all over it
Bopara to Johnson, no run back of a length and straight as Johnson just plays this to the leg side
Bopara to Johnson, no run prods forward to defend this fuller one to bring the over to an end
Stokes to Faulkner, no run just eases this one down to the fielder at long-on
Stokes to Faulkner, 1 wide pitches this slightly short as this one goes down the leg side
Stokes to Faulkner, 1 run turns this fuller one away to midwicket for one
Stokes to Johnson, no run yorker on middle which is drilled straight to silly mid-on
Stokes to Johnson, 1 leg bye length going down the pads as Johnson attempts to get this away
Stokes to Faulkner, 1 run leans into a drive through the covers, but is kept to just one
Stokes to Johnson, no run tries a slower one on a length which Johnson reads late as this goes harmlessly past the bat to the keeper
Bopara to Faulkner, 1 run length going down the pads as this is worked down to long-on
Bopara to Johnson, 1 run low full toss which is angled to the off side, beating a diving silly mid-on, before being recovered by long-on
Bopara to Faulkner, no run back of a length outside off which is punched straight to the covers
Bopara to Faulkner, 1 run squirts this one through point for a single to sweeper cover
Bopara to Johnson, no run pitches wide outside off as he looks to engineer a reverse-scoop over fine leg, but can't get a connection on it
Bopara to Johnson, 1 wide again down the same line, but a tad wider
Stokes to Faulkner, SIX runs and Faulkner has decided it is time to go as he deposits this length ball straight into the midwicket stand
Stokes to Faulkner, SIX runs Faulkner has stepped up a few gears as he just whacks this short one well over the square leg boundary for a huge six
Stokes to Faulkner, 1 run pitches this up as Faulkner is able to get it down to long-on for a single. This leaves McKay exposed at the other end, but he too can hit a long ball
Stokes to McKay, no run length coming in as this one is inside-edged onto the pad, with Stokes thinking he has got his man
Stokes to McKay, no run McKay gets forward to this length ball on and around off
Stokes to McKay, no run just plays this one to the fielder at cover, but doesn't want the run, as Faulkner will be back on strike next over
Bresnan to Faulkner, 1 run length outside off which is pushed to the covers
Bresnan to McKay, no run short ball just outside off which is defended off the back foot to the off side
Bresnan to McKay, no run drills this length ball straight to silly mid-off
Bresnan to McKay, 1 run short delivery on the off stump, McKay pulls it to deep mid-wicket
Bresnan to Faulkner, 1 run Bresnan surprises him with a full toss on the hips which is helped down to the man at deep fine leg for a single
Bresnan to McKay, no run tries to run this down to the man at third man, but hits it more square than fine as the over comes to an end
Stokes to Faulkner, 1 run fires in a fuller one which is worked down to the fielder at long-off
Stokes to McKay, 1 run swinging into the pads as this is eased down to long-on
Stokes to Faulkner, 2 runs able to squirt this full and wide one behind to third man, but can't beat the fielder. Still gains two valuable runs for his team
Stokes to Faulkner, no run bludgeons this with his rendition of Dhoni's helicopter, but this one unfortunately finds mid-off

Stokes to Faulkner, SIX runs dropped back of a length and this is all Faulkner needed as he goes after this with a pull shot. Root, running in from deep square leg, is able to get a hand on it before the boundary, but the momentum carries him over, ends up being called a six by the third umpire. Root really deserved that one as he was in control, but unfortunately cost his side two extra runs at the least
Stokes to Faulkner, 1 run again they are able to squirt this behind down to third man, but are kept to just one
Bresnan to Faulkner, no run slower ball outside off which is played tentatively towards point
Bresnan to Faulkner, no run another short slower ball which ends up being played back to th ebowler
Bresnan to Faulkner, 2 runs angling down the pads as this is helped off the hips by Faulkner, who is able to make it back for two

Bresnan to Faulkner, 2 runs on the back foot as this is pulled down to deep midwicket, with the pair running for their lives as they are able to scamper back for the second, and beat the incoming throw from the deep at the keeper's end
Bresnan to Faulkner, 1 run once again negotiates this shortish length slower ball to the leg side for a single

Bresnan to McKay, no run decides to fire in a bouncer which for all intensive purposes should have been called a wide by the third umpire, but Dharmasena just walks away from the spot. England lucky to get away with that one

Stokes to Faulkner, no run this one was heading down the pads as Faulkner decides to go with it and hit over cow corner, but gets a bit too early into the shot, with the ball falling safely to his right
Stokes to Faulkner, no run gets in a yorker on middle and leg which Faulkner is able to dig out successfully
Stokes to Faulkner, SIX runs back of a length and just crunched over the midwicket boundary for a huge six. Such a clean swing of the blade as this one just rises and rises into the stands

Stokes to Faulkner, SIX runs in the slot and suddenly images of Ishant start to come to the surface as Faulkner clears his front leg, and then clears the long-on boundary with another easy swing of the bat. This is sensational hitting from the Tasmanian allrounder
Stokes to Faulkner, no run third time not so lucky for Faulkner as clearly the adrenaline is getting to him now. Is lucky not to get bowled as this goes down the leg stump to the keeper
Stokes to Faulkner, 1 run fires it in on the blockhole as Faulkner eases this one down to long-on for a single, and more importantly for Australia, retain the striek

Bresnan to Faulkner, FOUR runs tries a slower bouncer which Faulkner is too early on as the ball runs off the face, and bounces over the keeper's outstretched gloves to the third man rope. Australia now need 8 off 5

Bresnan to Faulkner, FOUR runs sees this one early as Faulkner readies himself to this shorter one just outside off, before pulling this magnificently to midwicket for a one-bounce four which bifurcates the two fielders on the leg side

Bresnan to Faulkner, FOUR runs able to find the gap on the off side as he backs away to squirt this away through extra-cover, beating the fielder near the 30-yard circle, as this travels to the rope, sparking off scenes of delirium across the Gabba

Faulkner jumps in celebration as the Australians have pulled off an impressive heist here in Brisbane. Faulkner is proving to be a really valuable commodity for Australia of late, especially with the bat in hand. This has to go down as one of the all-time great Australia-England matches. The England fielders are in shock and Michael Slater is saluting Faulkner.

I have only ever seen this for a player's last match or when they play a truly special innings, and I guess the latter can describe Faulkner's knock as he is given a guard of honour by the Australian players and backroom staff. The Gabba has simply taken off over these last few minutes. Australia simply can not lose it seems.

Have you returned yet from the clouds? What a win this was for Australia as Faulkner proved that the Mohali heist was not a one-off. Can't recall a greater eruption from an Australian crowd in recent years. England will be slightly shell-shocked by what has just transpired, but they will need to pick themselves up by the straps and get mentally ready for the 3rd ODI, which will be played in Sydney in two days' tim
Australia won by 1 wicket (with 3 balls remaining)
Player of the match is James Faulkner, AUS
